item.title: T1 Line With Instant Wireless Backup
item.description:
Losing business broadband during a crucial moment can be incredibly frustrating. This is why many companies choose dedicated T1 lines instead of standard DSL or cable internet, despite the higher reliability of T1, they can still experience outages. Issues like equipment malfunctions or accidents can unexpectedly cut your connection. To prevent downtime, some companies opt for diverse T1 service, ordering two lines from separate providers. However, this solution isn’t foolproof, as both lines often use the same physical infrastructure owned by the Incumbent Local Exchange Carrier (ILEC)...

item.title: Broadband Insurance Keeps You in Business
item.description:
By: John Shepler Constant connectivity has its perks for individuals and businesses, but technology isn’t foolproof. A broadband outage can be incredibly isolating. Fortunately, there are safeguards against such situations. Consumers can utilize their mobile data as a backup. Modern smartphones can act as wireless hotspots, allowing devices like computers and printers to connect. While speed and data limits might be concerns, it provides a temporary solution. Another option is using public Wi-Fi hotspots, though availability might be an issue during widespread outages...
